official-title.#text:
To authorize a land exchange involving the acquisition of
		  private land adjacent to the Cibola National Wildlife Refuge in Arizona for
		  inclusion in the refuge in exchange for certain Bureau of Land Management lands
		  in Riverside County, California, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was referred to the

text.#text:
Certain
			 non-Federal lands adjacent to the Cibola National Wildlife Refuge in La Paz
			 County, Arizona, are desirable for Federal acquisition to protect important
			 riparian areas and migratory bird and other wildlife habitat.

The location of
			 certain Bureau of Land Management inholdings in Riverside County, California,
			 renders the land essentially useful only for farming and, therefore, of limited
			 use and enjoyment potential for the general public.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
in­hold­ings are appropriate for transfer to private ownership in exchange for
			 lands that will have higher public use values.

text.#text:
The acquisition of the non-Federal lands
			 adjacent to the Cibola National Wildlife Refuge will greatly increase
			 management efficiency of the refuge and promote public access, use, and
			 enjoyment of the refuge.

header.#text:
Land exchange,
			 Cibola National Wildlife Refuge, Arizona, and Bureau of Land Management land in
			 Riverside County, California

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall convey to River Bottom
			 Farms of La Paz County, Arizona, all right, title and interest of the United
			 States in and to certain Federal land administered by the

consisting of a total of approximately 80 acres, and
			 more specifically described as Lot 4 of Section 24, Township 8 South, Range 22
			 East, San Bernardino Meridian, Riverside County, California. The conveyed land
			 shall be subject to valid existing rights, including easements, rights-of-way,
			 utility lines, and any other valid encumbrances on the land as of the date of
			 the conveyance under this section.

text.#text: In exchange for the land described in

header.#text:
Conveyance of
			 bureau of land management land

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:

			 United States all right, title, and interest of River Bottom Farms in and to
			 two parcels of land contiguous to the Cibola National Wildlife Refuge in La Paz
			 County, Arizona, consisting of a total of approximately 40 acres and more
			 specifically described as follows:

The W½SW¼NE¼ of such Section 7, which is
			 also known as parcel number 301–05–008–0.

or River Bottom
			 Farms, as appropriate, pursuant to

through an appraisal performed by a qualified appraiser
			 mutually agreed to by the

and River Bottom Farms and performed in

text.#text:
The values of the
			 Federal land and non-Federal land to be exchanged under this section shall be
			 equal or equalized by the payment of cash to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
. The value of the land shall be determined
			 by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 206(b) of the Federal Land Policy
			 Management Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall complete the land exchange under
			 this section not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this
			 Act, unless the

and River Bottom Farms mutually agree to extend such
			 deadline.

shall become part of the Cibola National Wildlife Refuge and be
			 administered in accordance with the laws and regulations generally applicable
			 to the National Wildlife Refuge System.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 3006 IH: To authorize a land exchange involving the acquisition of private land adjacent to the Cibola National Wildlife Refuge in Arizona for inclusion in the refuge in exchange for certain Bureau of Land Management lands in Riverside County, California, and for other purposes.
